repnme.cdata!: Egypt - Second Matruh Resource Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Government's decision to
            initially seek partial and eventually full cancellation of
            the loan was based not on project specific factors but on
            country level changes in financing priorities. With
            Egypt's graduation from the international Development
            Association (IDA) in 1999, the Government had begun to
            closely evaluate the financial implications of new IBRD
            borrowings for projects that could be otherwise financed
            from grant resources. As this was a new issue at the time
            for the Bank and the Government was making determination in
            this regard on a case-by-case basis at the time, the
            decision on Matruh II was clarified only after IBRD Board
            approval. The major lesson learned: During the period of
            extended transition that follows graduation from IDA (and
            the implementation of the remaining IDA portfolio) and the
            commencement of IBRD borrowing, the Bank and the Government
            should jointly reconfirm the lending pipeline to ensure that
            projects continue to remain a priority on the new financing terms.

1637768.trustfund:
TF026827-PHRD-EGYPT: SECOND MATROUH
            RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PROJECT.

repnme.cdata!: Egypt - Second Matruh Resource Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Matruh Resource Management
            Project will improve the livelihoods of disadvantaged rural
            people living in the Northwest Coastal zone, reducing the
            incidence of poverty, through community development,
            capacity building, and access to services to help improve
            welfare, and increase incomes to conserve, rehabilitate, and
            use their natural resources in a sustainable manner. The
            project comprises six components as follows. Capacity
            building of communities includes an initial training,
            followed by a criteria, and processes for establishing
            development activities, prioritizing on resource allocation.
            It also includes women's development capacity, to allow
            them partake in the participatory planning process. The
            integrated natural resource management will focus on: water
            harvesting, and watershed management, through underground
            cisterns/reservoirs, dykes of water and soil retention, and,
            implementation of sustainable watershed management plans;
            develop a strategy for sustained use of communal resources,
            managing vegetation together with animals; and, integrate
            biodiversity conservation, through education, awareness, and
            capacity building, introducing alternative fuel sources. The
            development of productive activities comprises an extension
            outreach, and adaptive research for livestock, crop, and
            horticulture production, as well as off-farm productive
            activities, to diversify rural household incomes. The rural
            roads component will prod the possibility for further
            sources of income, while the revolving fund, and rural
            micro-finance component will support the establishment of
            professional credit retailers in the project area. Project
            management will fund technical assistance and monitoring, as
            well as equipment and vehicles.

2140346.trustfund:
TF026827-PHRD-EGYPT: SECOND MATROUH
            RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PROJECT.

repnme.cdata!:
Egypt - Second Matruh Resource Management
            Project (MRMP II) : environmental impact assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Matruh Resource Management
            Project's (MRMP II) Environmental Management Plan (EMP)
            is to identify the environmental mitigation measures,
            screening process, capacity building and monitoring
            activities to be undertaken, as well as the institutional
            arrangements to be set up to ensure that any potential
            adverse environmental impacts are either eliminated or
            minimized. The overall environmental impacts of the project
            are expected to be positive. The inclusion of the Global
            Environmental Facility component will ensure that
            environmental considerations are mainstreamed in the
            project. The environmental assessment identifies potential
            environmental impacts on drinking water quality. To reduce
            the impact of water contamination by sewage or animal
            wastes, cisterns will be dredged every three years to
            restore the dead storage capacity taken up by sedimentation.
            Animals will be kept away from the cisterns used for
            drinking water. Water treatment mitigation measures involve
            the sterilization of water. To reduce the potential impacts
            related to the range rehabilitation activities, the location
            will be planned and a connectivity between the areas for
            habitat will be maintained. Construction of cisterns must
            incorporate a silt trap, sediment basin and sieve on the
            inlet side of the cistern to reduce potential impacts from
            the small-scale infrastructure subprojects and rural roads.

display_title.display_title:
Egypt - Second Matruh Resource
            Management Project (MRMP II) : environmental impact
            assessment : Environmental management plan

1934943.trustfund:
TF026827-PHRD-EGYPT: SECOND MATROUH
            RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PROJECT.

repnme.cdata!:
Egypt - Second Matruh Resource Management
            Project (MRMP II) : environmental impact assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Matruh Resource Management
            Project's (MRMP II) Environmental Management Plan (EMP)
            is to identify the environmental mitigation measures,
            screening process, capacity building and monitoring
            activities to be undertaken, as well as the institutional
            arrangements to be set up to ensure that any potential
            adverse environmental impacts are either eliminated or
            minimized. The overall environmental impacts of the project
            are expected to be positive. The inclusion of the Global
            Environmental Facility component will ensure that
            environmental considerations are mainstreamed in the
            project. The environmental assessment identifies potential
            environmental impacts on drinking water quality. To reduce
            the impact of water contamination by sewage or animal
            wastes, cisterns will be dredged every three years to
            restore the dead storage capacity taken up by sedimentation.
            Animals will be kept away from the cisterns used for
            drinking water. Water treatment mitigation measures involve
            the sterilization of water. To reduce the potential impacts
            related to the range rehabilitation activities, the location
            will be planned and a connectivity between the areas for
            habitat will be maintained. Construction of cisterns must
            incorporate a silt trap, sediment basin and sieve on the
            inlet side of the cistern to reduce potential impacts from
            the small-scale infrastructure subprojects and rural roads.

docna.cdata!:
Process framework for community
            participation in biodiversity conservation and protected
            areas management

            Management Project (MRMP II) : environmental impact
